member.name: M:Sentry.Internal.SentryStackTraceFactory.DemangleAsyncFunctionName(Sentry.Protocol.SentryStackFrame)
member.summary: Clean up function and module names produced from `async` state machine calls.
member.para: When the Microsoft cs.exe compiler compiles some modern C# features, such as async/await calls, it can create synthetic function names that do not match the function names in the original source code. Here we reverse some of these transformations, so that the function and module names that appears in the Sentry UI will match the function and module names in the original source-code.

member.name: E:Sentry.Scope.OnEvaluating
member.summary: An event that fires when the scope evaluates
member.remarks: This allows registering an event handler that is invoked in case an event is about to be sent to Sentry. If an event is never sent, this event is never fired and the resources spared. It also allows registration at an early stage of the processing but execution at a later time, when more data is available.

member.name: P:Sentry.SentryOptions.Integrations
member.summary: A list of integrations to be added when the SDK is initialized

member.name: P:Sentry.SentryOptions.InAppExclude
member.summary: A list of namespaces (or prefixes) considered not part of application code
member.remarks: Sentry by default filters the stacktrace to display only application code. A user can optionally click to see all which will include framework and libraries. A is executed

member.name: P:Sentry.SentryOptions.SendDefaultPii
member.summary: Whether to include default Personal Identifiable information
member.remarks: By default PII data like Username and Client IP address are not sent to Sentry. When this flag is turned on, default PII data like Cookies, Claims in Web applications and user data read from the request are sent.

member.name: P:Sentry.SentryOptions.AttachStacktrace
member.summary: Whether to send the stack trace of a event captured without an exception
member.remarks: Append stack trace of the call to the SDK to capture a message or event without Exception

member.name: P:Sentry.SentryOptions.MaxBreadcrumbs
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum breadcrumbs.
member.remarks: When the number of events reach this configuration value, older breadcrumbs start dropping to make room for new ones.

member.name: F:Sentry.SentryOptions._sampleRate
member.summary: The rate to sample events
member.remarks: Can be anything between 0.01 (1%) and 1.0 (99.9%) or null (default), to disable it.

member.name: P:Sentry.SentryOptions.Release
member.summary: The release version of the application.
member.remarks:
This value will generally be something along the lines of the git SHA for the given project. If not explicitly defined via configuration or environment variable (SENTRY_RELEASE). It will attempt o read it from:
Don't rely on discovery if your release is: '1.0.0' or '0.0.0'. Since those are default values for new projects, they are not considered valid by the discovery process.

member.name: P:Sentry.SentryOptions.Environment
member.summary: The environment the application is running
member.remarks: This value can also be set via environment variable: SENTRY_ENVIRONMENT In some cases you don't need to set this manually since integrations, when possible, automatically fill this value. For ASP.NET Core which can read from IHostingEnvironment

member.name: P:Sentry.SentryOptions.Dsn
member.summary: The Data Source Name of a given project in Sentry.

member.name: P:Sentry.SentryOptions.BeforeSend
member.summary: A callback to invoke before sending an event to Sentry
member.remarks: The return of this event will be sent to Sentry. This allows the application a chance to inspect and/or modify the event before it's sent. If the event should not be sent at all, return null from the callback.

member.name: P:Sentry.SentryOptions.BeforeBreadcrumb
member.summary: A callback invoked when a breadcrumb is about to be stored.
member.remarks: Gives a chance to inspect and modify/reject a breadcrumb.

member.name: P:Sentry.SentryOptions.MaxQueueItems
member.summary: The maximum number of events to keep while the worker attempts to send them

member.name: P:Sentry.SentryOptions.ShutdownTimeout
member.summary: How long to wait for events to be sent before shutdown
member.remarks: In case there are events queued when the SDK is closed, upper bound limit to wait for the worker to send the events to Sentry.
member.example: The SDK is closed while the queue has 1 event queued. The worker takes 50 milliseconds to send an event to Sentry. Even though default settings say 2 seconds, closing the SDK would block for 50ms.

member.name: P:Sentry.SentryOptions.DecompressionMethods
member.summary: Decompression methods accepted
member.remarks: By default accepts all available compression methods supported by the platform

member.name: P:Sentry.SentryOptions.RequestBodyCompressionLevel
member.summary: The level of which to compress the before sending to Sentry
member.remarks: To disable request body compression, use

member.name: P:Sentry.SentryOptions.RequestBodyCompressionBuffered
member.summary: Whether the body compression is buffered and the request 'Content-Length' known in advance.
member.remarks: Without reading through the Gzip stream to have its final size, it's no possible to use 'Content-Length' header value. That means 'Content-Encoding: chunked' has to be used which is sometimes not supported. Sentry on-premise without a reverse-proxy, for example, does not support 'chunked' requests.

member.name: P:Sentry.SentryOptions.HttpProxy
member.summary: An optional web proxy

member.summary: A callback invoked when a is created.

member.name: P:Sentry.SentryOptions.ConfigureClient
member.summary: A callback invoked when a is created.

member.summary: Whether to log diagnostics messages
member.remarks: The verbosity can be controlled through and the implementation via .

member.name: P:Sentry.SentryOptions.DiagnosticsLevel
member.summary: The diagnostics level to be used
member.remarks: The flag has to be switched on for this setting to take effect.

member.name: P:Sentry.SentryOptions.DiagnosticLogger
member.summary: The implementation of the logger.
member.remarks: The flag has to be switched on for this logger to be used at all. When debugging is turned off, this property is made null and any internal logging results in a no-op.

member.name: M:Sentry.SentrySdk.BindClient(Sentry.ISentryClient)
member.summary: Binds the client to the current scope.

member.name: M:Sentry.SentrySdk.AddBreadcrumb(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String},Sentry.Protocol.BreadcrumbLevel)
member.summary: Adds a breadcrumb to the current Scope
member.param: If a message is provided it‚Äôs rendered as text and the whitespace is preserved. Very long text might be abbreviated in the UI.
The type of breadcrumb. The default type is default which indicates no specific handling. Other types are currently http for HTTP requests and navigation for navigation events.

Categories are dotted strings that indicate what the crumb is or where it comes from. Typically it‚Äôs a module name or a descriptive string. For instance ui.click could be used to indicate that a click happened in the UI or flask could be used to indicate that the event originated in the Flask framework.
Data associated with this breadcrumb. Contains a sub-object whose contents depend on the breadcrumb type. Additional parameters that are unsupported by the type are rendered as a key/value table.

member.name: M:Sentry.SentrySdk.AddBreadcrumb(Sentry.Infrastructure.ISystemClock,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String},Sentry.Protocol.BreadcrumbLevel)
member.summary: Adds a breadcrumb to the current scope
member.remarks: This overload is intended to be used by integrations only. The objective is to allow better testability by allowing control of the timestamp set to the breadcrumb.

member.name: M:Sentry.SentrySdk.WithScope(System.Action{Sentry.Scope})
member.summary: Runs the callback with a new scope which gets dropped at the end
member.remarks: Pushes a new scope, runs the callback, pops the scope.
member.param: The callback to run with the one time scope.
